Comment: Do you mean during the battle or in the official remarks afterwards?  Russian Ministry of Defence might genuinely not have known that Wagner were there. Although Wagner are sometimes portrayed as an arm of the Russian state, they also have their own financial interests and goals that sometimes contradict or conflict with the actual government's. Russia also had an agreement with the US about how many pro-regime forces could be in the area, as part of a 'de-confliction' line, and may not have wanted to appear that they were intentionally jeopardising it.   As for the actual battle, it's not apparent that hundreds of Russian security contractors were actually killed in battle with the US; [Spiegel reporting](https://www.spiegel.de/international/world/american-fury-the-truth-about-the-russian-deaths-in-syria-a-1196074.html) suggests that the Russians were in a support role for a militia attempting to take the oil fields, and collateral damage when retaliatory airstrikes hit, and that it was dozens not hundreds of casualties. It was fighters of other nationalities that were killed in the actual battle.   At any rate, whether they were killed in the rear or in actual combat with Americans, it is not in the Kremlin's interest (or self-perceived interest) to acknowledge embarrassing combat loses. The Kremlin is habitually dishonest when it comes to 'special military operations' of all kinds.
